724927f-a.text:
York Avenue (Avenue A), north from above 91st Street to the end of the Avenue at 93rd Street, showing the municipal ferry to Astoria.

Because of the shore line of the East River, Avenue A as surveyed in 1811 is not continuous. This is the northern end of the second part of it, from 54th to 93rd Streets, known below 60th Street as Sutton Place and Sutton Place South, and as York Avenue (since late 1928) above 60th Street. The third section, beginning at 107th Street, is Pleasant Avenue.

January 31, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

724925f-a.text:
York Avenue, west side, between 91st and 92nd Streets, a coal yard occupied by the Riverside Fuel Company, which has just taken over the old lumber and coal yards in the block north of 93rd Street west of York Avenue, at the northern and of York Avenue.
March 29, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

724926f.text:
York Ave., west side, north from and including East 91st to 92nd Streets. At this point the upper link of the East River Drive begins.
December 15, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
